1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A.J. Kassanavoid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Amended 7/28/15:  Restitution is ordered.  Restitution is to be paid 1st over any other court costs or financial obligations.   Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.

You will maintain and obtain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education that is equivalent of being occupied full-time, and your employment will be in an occupation approved by your agent.  You will not voluntarily quit your employment without your agent's approval.

You will submit to an alcohol assessment and comply with all treatment and programming recommended by such assessment.    Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.

You will submit to a drug assessment and comply with all treatment and programming recommended by such assessment.    Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.

You must have no access to internet, computers, or pornographic material.  Must have no contact with the victim unless both she and your supervising agent agree.  You may not consume or possess any alcoholic beverages or be present where it is sold or served.  You may not consume and you may not possess any controlled substances unless you have a valid prescription, and then you will take that prescribed medication exactly as it is directed to be taken.  You will not possess any item of drug paraphernalia.  You will not associate with any known drug dealers or any known drug users or their residences.  You will not allow yourself to be present at any place where controlled substances are used or are illegally sold.  You will completely sever all ties to the drug sub-culture.  You must have no contact with the victim unless your agent and the victim agree.  You must have no unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 18.

You must submit a DNA sample if you have not already done so.  The DNA surcharge is not being assessed.  You must comply with Wisconsin's sex offender registry law for the remainder of your natural life.  Must undergo a sex offender assessment if not addressed at your initial confinement.  Must comply with all sex offender rules.  You must obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.  You must comply with a risk and needs assessments and any other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.  You must comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs and follow through with all programming recommended by the Department of Corrections.  You will successfully complete the DOC's CGIP program.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.    Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  You must obtain and maintain housing which is approved by your supervising agent.
Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel Keith Belzer present.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Belzer states he received the PSI just last Friday and has reveiwed with his client today.  After direction by the Court attorney Belzer conferred with his client twice to be sure it is his wish to proceed today with sentencing.  Defendant stated he wishes to proceed.  Victim's mother made a statement.  ADA Inlow states there is a joint recommendation for a bifurcated sentence on both counts concurrent of 16 years; 8 years initial confinement and 8 years extended supervision with conditions.  Judge Goodman states there is a restitution request of $862.50.  Attorney Keith Belzer states he also just received that last Friday and requests the statutory 60 days to object.  Court sentences on counts 6 & 7:  18 years bifurcated - 10 years initial confinement and 8 years extended supervision on both counts; concurrent with 319 days sentence credit on both counts.  Extended supervision conditions are:  If no objection to restitution by 7/25/15 the Order for Restitution will be signed and assessed to the case.  Must comply with Wisconsin's sex offender registry law for the remainder of natural life.  Must have no contact with the victim unless both she and your supervision agent agree; No access to internet, computers, or pornographic material.  Must undergo a sex offender assessment if not addressed at your intial confinement.  Must comply with all sex offender rules.  You must obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.  You must comply with a risk and needs assessments and any other screeninig tools identified by the Department of Corrections.  You must comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs and follow through with all programming recommended by the Department of Corrections.  You may not consume or possess any alcoholic beverages or be present where it is sold or served.  You may not consume and you may not possess any controlled substances unless you have a valid prescription, and then you will take that prescribed medication exactly as it is directed to be taken.  You will not possess any item of drug paraphernalia.  You will not associate with any know drug dealers or any know drug users or their residences.  You will not allow yourself to be present at any place where controlled substances are used or are illegally sold.  You will completely sever all ties to the drug sub-culture.  You will maintain and obtain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education that is equivalent of being occupied full-time, and your employment will be in an occupation approved by your agent.  You will not voluntarily quit your employment without your agent's approval.  You will submit to an AODA and comply with all treatment and programming recommended by such assessment.  You will successfully complete the DOC's CGIP program.  Must pay the costs of the action and costs of supervision.  You will not be required to pay the DNA surcharge but must submit a DNA sample if not already done.  Not eligible for CIP; eligible for ERP.
Restitution worksheet

Court reviewed plea questionnaire, constitutional rights waived, and elements.  Defendant understands.  Court finds defendant has made his plea, and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Belzer.  Defendant plead guilty to counts 6 and 7.  Attorney Belzer stipulates to a factual basis.  Court finds a factual basis.  Find guilty as plead to.  Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 and 10 dismissed and read in for purposes of sentencing.  PSI ordered.  Due 10 days before sentencing.  Sentencing to be scheduled.
